titlestmt.titleproper: Lois Stifel collection of tobacco ephemera
Guide to the Lois Stifel collection of tobacco ephemera, 1880-2019 and undated RL.11677
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-01-08 16:18:51 -0500.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Lois Stifel collection of tobacco ephemera

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Collection includes print advertisements, accessories and merchandise catalogs, collector newsletters, direct mailings, cigarette and tobacco labels and packaging, point of sale displays, sheet music, memorabilia and collectibles, tobacco tins, smoking and smoking cessation paraphernalia, juvenile and adult literature, research reports and articles on smoking and health and other printed materials, along with audio and video cassettes and optical discs. Materials primarily relate to smoking, tobacco use and prevention in the United States but some international examples are also present. Materials also relate to the tobacco industry in North Carolina. Companies represented include Alfred Dunhill, American Cancer Society, American Legacy Foundation, American Lung Association, American Tobacco Company, Brown & Williamson, Liggett & Myers, National Cancer Institute, National Institutes of Health (NIH), Philip Morris, R.J. Reynolds, Tobacco Institute, U.S. Surgeon General and Zippo. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Advertising; Artifacts and Memorabilia; Cigarette and Tobacco Packaging; Printed Materials; Audiovisual Materials.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, original audiovisual materials are closed until use copies can be produced.
A selection of published print materials has been removed from the collection and cataloged separately. Consult the Duke University Libraries catalog for these titles.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Lois Stifel collection of tobacco ephemera was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2017-2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Lois Stifel collection of tobacco ephemera, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Walker Comer and Richard Collier, Dec. 2018
Accessions described in this collection guide: 2017-0086

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:
J. Walter Thompson Company. Competitive Advertisements;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Dan Seymour papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Domestic Advertisements;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Loy Baxter papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Review Board records;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Shirley F. Woodall papers;
J. Walter Thompson Company. Thomas Sutton papers;
Outdoor Advertising Association of America slide library;
Richard Pollay Tobacco Industry Promotion (TIPS) collection;

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes print advertisements, accessories and merchandise catalogs, collector newsletters, direct mailings, cigarette and tobacco labels and packaging, point of sale displays, sheet music, memorabilia and collectibles, tobacco tins, smoking and smoking cessation paraphernalia, juvenile and adult literature, research reports and articles on smoking and health and other printed materials, along with audio and video cassettes and optical discs. Materials primarily relate to smoking, tobacco use and prevention in the United States but some international examples are also present. Materials also relate to the tobacco industry in North Carolina. Companies represented include Alfred Dunhill, American Cancer Society, American Legacy Foundation, American Lung Association, American Tobacco Company, Brown & Williamson, Liggett & Myers, National Cancer Institute, National Institutes of Health (NIH), Philip Morris, R.J. Reynolds, Tobacco Institute, U.S. Surgeon General and Zippo. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

scopecontent.p: Includes national flags and a verse of the national hymn, song, air or anthem, or patriotic/folk tune. Countries represented: Brazil, Bulgaria, China, Cuba, Egypt, Japan, Poland, Scotland, Sweden, Switzerland, Wales
